properties.name: Switch Property View
properties.desc: Edit the current module properties.

properties.name: Visible
properties.desc: Controls the visibility of the object.

properties.name: Pickable
properties.desc: Controls whether the object can be picked interactively in the viewer.

properties.name: Opacity
properties.desc: Controls the opacity of the object.

properties.name: Faces To Display
properties.desc: Controls which faces of the object are displayed.

properties.name: Face Culling
properties.desc: Controls which faces of the object are displayed.

properties.name: Color By
properties.desc: The Color By control allows the user to set how the color of the output should be determined.

properties.name: Node Data Datamap
properties.desc: Controls how the color is mapped onto the resulting object based off the data contained within the renderable.

properties.name: Cell Data Datamap
properties.desc: Controls how the color is mapped onto the resulting object based off the data contained within the renderable.

properties.name: Object Secondary Color
properties.desc: Sets the Objects Secondary Color.

properties.name: Normals Generation
properties.desc: Controls how normals are generated for surfaces.  Cell normals will cause faceting.  Vertex normals will create smooth surfaces.

properties.name: Rendering Priority
properties.desc: Controls the rendering priority of the object.  Higher values will cause the renderable to have preferential treatment over other renderables in the same space.

properties.name: Glyph Normals
properties.desc: Controls how normals are generated for glyphs, including spheres.  Cell normals will cause faceting.  Vertex normals will create smooth surfaces.

properties.name: Auto Orient Normals
properties.desc: Recompute new normals and reorient all triangles to face outward when possible.

properties.name: Force Consistent Normals
properties.desc: Flip normals on adjancent triangles to make surface normals consistent.

properties.name: Max Edge Angle
properties.desc: The Max Edge Angle angle is defined as the angle between two faces or cells in the model.

properties.name: Use Alternate Object
properties.desc: Determines whether an alternate, simple rendering is used while rotating to improve performance while interacting with the Viewer.

properties.name: Point Display Mode
properties.desc: Controls how points are rendered in the Viewer.  NOTE: Not all options are supported by most graphics cards.

properties.name: Line Display Mode
properties.desc: Controls how lines are rendered in the Viewer.  NOTE: Not all options are supported by most graphics cards.

properties.name: Hide Cell Outlines
properties.desc: Determines whether the outlines of cells are included in the rendering when using an appropriate Line Display Mode, or whether we only display actual line and polyline cells.

properties.name: Surface Display Mode
properties.desc: Controls how surfaces are rendered in the Viewer.

properties.name: Volume Display Mode
properties.desc: Controls how volumes are rendered in the Viewer.

properties.name: Bounds Display Mode
properties.desc: Controls how the boundaries of objects are rendered in the Viewer.

properties.name: Ambient
properties.desc: The Ambient value affects the brightness of objects with respect to ambient (non-directional or Lambertian reflection) lighting.

properties.name: Diffuse
properties.desc: The Diffuse value affects the brightness of objects with respect to diffuse (directional or specular reflection) lighting.

properties.name: Specular
properties.desc: The Specular value determines the brightness and focus of white specular highlights on objects whose surface normal reflects the directional light source back to the viewer. This could also be considered shininess

properties.name: Gloss
properties.desc: The Gloss value determines the brightness on objects whose surface normal reflects the directional light source back to the viewer. This could also be considered shininess.

properties.name: Line Style
properties.desc: The Line Style affects how lines are drawn.

properties.name: Line Thickness
properties.desc: The Line Thickness sets the width of lines in pixels, and can be set to values ranging from 0 to 25. Zero is a special fast version of one pixel wide.

properties.name: Glyph Size
properties.desc: Glyph Size applies only to special geometries.

properties.name: Subdivision
properties.desc: The Subdivision value controls the number of element subdivisions to be performed before drawing of lines along surfaces (grids). The higher the number, the more accurately the lines will be placed through the data. Higher accuracy does not always cause the lines to become smoother, depending on the data distribution.

properties.name: Smooth Lines
properties.desc: The Smooth Lines toggle creates a (sometimes) pleasing display of lines. The jagged display along pixel divisions is darkened and blurred to create a somewhat smoother (softer) appearance. Smooth lines produces thicker anti-aliased lines.
